description.para: IDA can keep information about source files used to create the program. Each source file is represented by a range of addresses. A source file may contain several address ranges.

detaileddescription.para:
Mark a range of address as belonging to a source file. An address range may belong only to one source file. A source file may be represented by several address ranges.
ea1
linear address of start of the address range
ea2
linear address of end of the address range (excluded)
filename
name of source file.
success

Get name of source file occupying the given address.
ea
linear address
bounds
pointer to the output buffer with the address range for the current file. May be NULL.
NULL if source file information is not found, otherwise returns pointer to file name

Delete information about the source file.
ea
linear address
success

memberdef.argsstring: (size_t width, void(idaapi *get_user_defined_prefix)(qstring *buf, ea_t ea, int lnnum, int indent, const char *line))
memberdef.name: set_user_defined_prefix

param.type: void(idaapi *)(qstring *buf, ea_t ea, int lnnum, int indent, const char *line)

detaileddescription.para:
User-defined line-prefixes are displayed just after the autogenerated line prefixes. In order to use them, the plugin should call the following function to specify its width and contents.
width
the width of the user-defined prefix
get_user_defined_prefix
a callback to get the contents of the prefix. Its arguments:
buf: the output buffer
ea: linear address
indent: see explanations for gen_printf().
line: the line to be generated. the line usually contains color tags. this argument can be examined to decide whether to generated the prefix.
In order to remove the callback before unloading the plugin, specify the width or the callback == NULL.

memberdef.argsstring: (ea_t ea, int vel_flags, const char *format, va_list va)
memberdef.name: vadd_extra_line

detaileddescription.para:
Add anterior/posterior non-comment line(s).
ea
linear address
isprev
do we add anterior lines? (0-no, posterior)
format
printf() style format string. may contain \n to denote new lines.
true if success

Add anterior/posterior comment line(s).
ea
linear address
isprev
do we add anterior lines? (0-no, posterior)
format
printf() style format string. may contain \n to denote new lines. The resulting string should not contain comment characters (;), the kernel will add them automatically.
true if success

Add anterior comment line(s) at the start of program.
format
printf() style format string. may contain \n to denote new lines. The resulting string should not contain comment characters (;), the kernel will add them automatically.
true if success
Escape character (ON).
Escape character (OFF).
Escape character (Quote next character). This is needed to output '\1' and '\2' characters.
Escape character (Inverse foreground and background colors). This escape character has no corresponding COLOR_OFF. Its action continues until the next COLOR_INV or end of line.

briefdescription.para: Size of a tagged address (see COLOR_ADDR)

detaileddescription.para:
This macro is used to build colored string constants (e.g. for format strings)
str
string literal to surround with color tags
tag
one of SCOLOR_xxx constants
color tag - see Color tags
hidden address marks. the address is represented as 8digit hex number: 01234567. it doesn't have COLOR_OFF pair. NB: for 64-bit IDA, the address is 16digit.

briefdescription.para: This tag is reserved for internal IDA use.
Lumina-related, only for the navigation band.
Is the given char a color escape character?

detaileddescription.para:
Insert an address mark into a string.
buf
pointer to the output buffer; the tag will be appended or inserted into it
ea
address to include
ins
if true, the tag will be inserted at the beginning of the buffer

memberdef.definition: idaman THREAD_SAFE const char* ida_export tag_advance
memberdef.name: tag_advance

detaileddescription.para:
Move pointer to a 'line' to 'cnt' positions right. Take into account escape sequences.
line
pointer to string
cnt
number of positions to move right
moved pointer

memberdef.definition: idaman THREAD_SAFE const char* ida_export tag_skipcodes
memberdef.name: tag_skipcodes

detaileddescription.para:
Move the pointer past all color codes.
line
can't be NULL
moved pointer, can't be NULL

memberdef.definition: idaman THREAD_SAFE const char* ida_export tag_skipcode
memberdef.name: tag_skipcode

detaileddescription.para:
Skip one color code. This function should be used if you are interested in color codes and want to analyze all of them. Otherwise tag_skipcodes() function is better since it will skip all colors at once. This function will skip the current color code if there is one. If the current symbol is not a color code, it will return the input.
moved pointer

Calculate length of a colored string This function computes the length in unicode codepoints of a line
the number of codepoints in the line, or -1 on error

Remove color escape sequences from a string.
buf
output buffer with the string, can not be NULL.
str
input string, can not be NULL.
init_level
used to verify that COLOR_ON and COLOR_OFF tags are balanced
length of resulting string, -1 if error

Get prefix color for line at 'ea'
Line prefix colors

Get background color for line at 'ea'
RGB color

briefdescription.para: High level functions that deal with the generation of the disassembled text lines.

detaileddescription.para: This file also contains definitions for the syntax highlighting.
Finally there are functions that deal with anterior/posterior user-defined lines.
